existing_features.title: Create a responsive single-page website whose layout and styling matches the reference photo/design the user will provide. Implement the page structure so the reference photo can be placed as a prominent visual element (e.g., hero/cover area) using a static asset stored in the frontend.
Add an 'Opening Letter' section on the landing page that displays the user-provided text message(s) in English, formatted as a readable letter (title/greeting/body/closing).

Establish a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across the page, aligned with the provided reference photo/design once available. Do not use a blue-and-purple default palette unless the user’s reference explicitly uses it.

Update the Opening Letter section to display the exact user-provided Valentine’s Day letter text (including emojis and paragraph/line breaks) instead of the current placeholder content, while keeping the existing letter styling (card layout, typography, spacing) intact.

Add the user-uploaded image(s) (683CEC41-3F5D-48A7-A96D-FC2FE9C2332B.png and 683CEC41-3F5D-48A7-A96D-FC2FE9C2332B-1.png) to the frontend as static assets and update the Hero section to use one of them as the hero background image instead of the current /assets/reference-photo.jpg placeholder.

Add background music playback for the requested “Hi Nana” movie BGM with a visible play/pause control on the page, and ensure playback behavior respects browser autoplay restrictions (i.e., music should start only after a user interaction if autoplay is blocked).

Prepare the updated site for publishing by ensuring the build outputs a working, self-contained static frontend bundle with the new image asset(s) and background music asset referenced correctly via public paths.

Add the newly uploaded images (683CEC41-3F5D-48A7-A96D-FC2FE9C2332B-2.png and 683CEC41-3F5D-48A7-A96D-FC2FE9C2332B-3.png) to the frontend as static assets and update the beginning of the page (the Hero section at the top) to display one of these new images instead of the currently referenced uploaded hero image.
